title: Lady Gaga in 'a lot of pain' after fall from stage as she attends best friend's bachelorette party
text:
Lady Gaga is in 'a lot of pain' after she took an accidental fall off stage this week.

But the 33-year-old didn't let her injuries stop her from attending her best friend's bachelorette party Friday.

She wrote on Instagram: 'I might be in a lot of pain but I couldn't miss my best friends bachelorette dinner.'

A lot of pain: Lady Gaga is in 'a lot of pain' after she took an accidental fall off stage this week

Gaga shared a photo of herself dressed in black with pink hair and bold eye makeup, as she held a pair of bridesmaid glasses in her hand.

She suffered her injuries on Thursday, when an over-excited fan picked up the Shallow artist during her Las Vegas residency.

They both fell off the side of the stage with her legs wrapped around his waist, as he landed on top of her in the audience.

Although it appeared to be a nasty fall, Gaga immediately jumped up and comforted the distraught fan who dropped her before carrying on with her set.

Powering through: But the 33-year-old didn't let her injuries stop her from attending her best friend's bachelorette party Friday

She said: 'The only thing that's not okay is we need some stairs for the damn stage so I can get back up.

'You alright? Come on up! Everything's fine! It's not your fault, let's go, come on. Are you okay?'

She later joked about the incident, saying: '11 years [of being a fan] and we f***ing love each other so much we fall off the damn stage... We were like Rose and Jack from the Titanic.'

Number one fan: The incident took place Thursday, when an over-excited fan picked up the Shallow artist during her Las Vegas residency

Stage dive: They both fell off the side of the stage with her legs wrapped around his waist, as he landed on top of her in the audience

All good: Although it appeared to be a nasty fall, Gaga immediately jumped up and comforted the distraught fan who dropped her before carrying on with her set

The A Star is Born actress underwent a full body X-ray immediately after the show, later updating fans on the outcome.

She posted a photo of her hand under the x-ray, as she made the 'okay' symbol with her fingers.

Referencing her 2008 song Just Dance, she wrote: 'When they have to X-Ray almost your entire body...Just Dance. Gonna be ok.'
description: The A Star is Born actress underwent a full body X-ray immediately after the show, later updating fans on the outcome: 'When they have to X-Ray almost your entire body...Just Dance. Gonna be ok.'
